verb.description: Apply or bring to bear (a force, influence, or quality)
examples: the moon exerts a force on the Earth
exerting influence over the next generation

verb.description: Make a physical or mental effort.
examples: he needs to exert himself to try to find an answer

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense perform, practice): from Latin exserere put forth, from ex- out + serere bind.
